title: â€™28 Years Later IIIâ€™ Going Forward at Sony; Alex Garland Writing and Cillian Murphy in Talks to Return
description: A third â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ movie is moving forward at Sony. Sony Pictures has decided to proceed with the film following positive fan reactions to ear
body:
A third â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ movie is moving forward at Sony. Sony Pictures has decided to proceed with the film following positive fan reactions to early screenings of the trilogyâ€™s second installment, â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Temple,â€ according to sources familiar with the development. Series screenwriter Alex Garland is writing the script for the film and Cillian Murphy is in talks to reprise his role as protagonist Jim from â€œ28 Days Laterâ€ and â€œThe Bone Temple.â€
	

	The zombie horror franchise began in 2001 with Fox Searchlightâ€™s release of â€œ28 Days Later,â€ directed by Danny Boyle. The influential and intense film grossed over $72 million at the worldwide box office on a reported $8 million budget. Fox Atomicâ€” a short-lived Fox subsidiaryâ€” released an initial sequel, â€œ28 Weeks Laterâ€ in 2007. The sequel had an entirely new cast and neither Boyle nor Garland were involved. 

	Earlier this summer, â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ returned to form with Garland and Boyle returning to write and direct the film. The duo envisioned â€œ28 Yearsâ€ as a trilogy, Sony made the first two films, â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ and â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€ back to back before greenlighting the third. 


	â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ performed well at the box office, opening to $30 million on June 20 and cumulatively grossing $151 million worldwide. â€œThe Bone Templeâ€ is directed by Nia DaCosta and releases in theaters on Jan. 16, but early screenings have evidently given Sony the confidence to complete the trilogy.

	Alfie Williams, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Jodie Comer, Jack Oâ€™Connell and Ralph Fiennes all starred in the first â€œ28 Years Later.â€ All but Comer will return in â€œThe Bone Temple,â€ alongside franchise newcomers Erin Kellyman and Chi Lewis-Parry and Murphy, reprising his role from â€œ28 Days Laterâ€ for the first time since the initial filmâ€™s release.
	

	Though Murphy is in talks to come back again in the the third installment, no official announcement has been made regarding the cast. Boyle has expressed interest in directing the third installment in previous statements, but there has been no confirmation.

	The news was first reported by Deadline.

schema.headline: â€™28 Years Later IIIâ€™ Going Forward at Sony; Alex Garland Writing and Cillian Murphy in Talks to Return

title: â€˜Iron Chef,â€™ â€˜Forensic Filesâ€™ Among FAST Channels in Radial-Telus Canada Deal (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Radial Entertainment has secured a licensing agreement with Telus Communications to bring five fan-favorite FAST channels to the telecom giantâ€™s str
body:
Radial Entertainment has secured a licensing agreement with Telus Communications to bring five fan-favorite FAST channels to the telecom giantâ€™s streaming platforms in Canada.

	The deal makes Radialâ€™s â€œIron Chef,â€ â€œForensic Files,â€ â€œHot Ones,â€ â€œUnsolved Mysteriesâ€ and â€œUntold Stories of the ERâ€ channels available on Telus TV and Stream+, comprising more than 910 hours of content. The channels launched on the Telus TV+ app for all Optik TV and Stream+ subscribers at no additional cost.
	

	â€œWeâ€™re thrilled to make these highly popular FAST channels available to Canadian audiences at Telus and enhance their fast-growing Connected TV and streaming business,â€ said Daniel Gagliardi, executive VP of North American digital distribution at Radial Entertainment. â€œPartnering with Telus, a communications technology powerhouse serving millions of Canadians, allows us to leverage our FAST expertise on a scale that will truly transform how audiences discover and enjoy premium content.â€


	The channels are featured in the Free Streaming Channels section and channel guide on Telusâ€™ platforms, which currently offer more than 70 FAST channels to subscribers.

	The deal was negotiated by Jenna Pascuzzo, director of North American digital distribution at Radial Entertainment, with Michael Smith of Warburn Consulting advising, alongside Telus Communications.

	Radial Entertainment is a newly formed global entertainment company operating the FilmRise and Shout! Studios brands, backed by funds managed by Oaktree Capital Management. The companyâ€™s library contains more than 70,000 movies and episodes across genres including true crime, reality, animation, action, westerns, medical, food and horror. Paramount Global alumÂ Jeff Shultz will take charge as CEO from Jan. 1, 2026.  
	

	Telus operates in more than 45 countries and generates over $20 billion in annual revenue, serving more than 20 million customer connections.

schema.headline: â€˜Iron Chef,â€™ â€˜Forensic Filesâ€™ Among FAST Channels in Radial-Telus Canada Deal (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Sundance Title â€˜How to Divorce During the Warâ€™ Boarded by New Europe (EXCLUSIVE)
description: New Europe Film Sales has acquired â€œHow to Divorce During the War,â€ the third feature by Lithuanian director Andrius BlaÅ¾eviÄius, ahead of its world
body:
New Europe Film Sales has acquired â€œHow to Divorce During the War,â€ the third feature by Lithuanian director Andrius BlaÅ¾eviÄius, ahead of its world premiere in the Sundance Film Festivalâ€™s World Cinema Dramatic Competition.

	New Europe described the film as â€œa sharp, emotionally resonant drama laced with irony.â€ It is â€œa portrait of a Europe caught between fear and denial, solidarity and fatigue, ideals and comfort.â€
	

	Set in Vilnius in 2022, itâ€™s a story of a high-flying executive Marija, who chooses the worst possible moment for an honest conversation with her husband Vytas about divorcing â€“ just one day before Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine goes into full scale. Now the couple must navigate the process of separation as it collides with a refugee and mid-life crisis.


	The film works both as a relationship drama and a war film and shows an ironic duality of the coupleâ€™s mid-life crisis and the life of the Ukrainian refugees in Vilnius. Everyday domestic situations carry an undercurrent of frustration and hidden violence, moments of chaos and absurdity coexist with heartbreak. The tension between Marija, Vytas, and their daughter DovilÄ— quietly reveals the aftershocks of both divorce and war.

	The filmâ€™s creative team includes DP Narvydas Naujalis, editor Anna Johnson RyndovÃ¡, production designer Greta VileikytÄ— and composer Jakub Rataj. It is produced by Marija Razgute of M-Films (Lithuania), with co-producers Red Lion (Luxembourg), Feline Films (Ireland), and Bionaut (Czech Rep.).

	The project participated in the New Nordic Films Co-Production Market and the Berlinale Co-Production Market.
	

	BlaÅ¾eviÄius previously gained international recognition with â€œThe Saintâ€ (Warsaw and Busan film festivals) and â€œRunnerâ€ (Karlovy Vary Film Festival).

	New Europeâ€™s head of acquisitions, Marcin Luczaj, said in a statement: â€œWeâ€™ve been struck and impressed with Andriusâ€™ vision and the universe, which resonated with us closely. The film is blending an intimate relationship drama with the tension of a society under pressure, and strikes a rare tonal balance: emotionally raw yet sharply observant, contemporary yet universally relatable, tragic yet often darkly comedic.â€

	New Europeâ€™s slate includes Dara van Dusenâ€™s upcoming â€œA Prayer for the Dying,â€ starring Johnny Flynn and John C. Reilly, Jeremiah Zagarâ€™s â€œThe Painted Bride,â€ starring Jeremy Allen White, as well as two competitors for the international feature film Oscar â€“ Hlynur PÃ¡lmasonâ€™s â€œThe Love That Remainsâ€ (Iceland) and Laszlo Nemesâ€™ â€œOrphanâ€ (Hungary).

schema.headline: Sundance Title â€˜How to Divorce During the Warâ€™ Boarded by New Europe (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Taylor Swift Reveals Two Favorite Songs From Her Catalog on â€˜The Late Show With Stephen Colbertâ€™: Rankings are â€˜Constantly Changingâ€™
description: Taylor Swift revealed two of her favorite songs from her own catalog during a Wednesday night appearance on â€œThe Late Show With Stephen Colbert.â€
body:
Taylor Swift revealed two of her favorite songs from her own catalog during a Wednesday night appearance on â€œThe Late Show With Stephen Colbert.â€

	Colbert initially asked Swift for her top five, a question he previously asked Dolly Parton, Elton John, Paul Simon and Bruce Springsteen. However, the 14-time Grammy winner told the late-night host that her rankings are â€œconstantly changing,â€ and that she would need â€œa little timeâ€ to get back to him on all five.
	

	â€œI think number one is â€˜All Too Well,â€™ the 10-minute version,â€ Swift said. â€œIâ€™m really obsessed with â€˜The Life of a Showgirl,â€™ the whole album.â€


	She continued, â€œI canâ€™t really do any of the others, except I will say somewhere in the list, I think, is going to be a song called â€˜Mirrorball,â€™ from the â€˜Folkloreâ€™ album. You know, it came on the other day. A friend sent it to me, and she was talking about it, and I put it on, and then you asked me this question, so I said it.â€

	Swift assured that at some point, she would give Colbert an â€œupdateâ€ after she had sat down and deeply considered her definitive top five favorites.

	At the beginning of November, Swiftâ€™s latest album, â€œThe Life of a Showgirl,â€ logged its fourth week in a row at No. 1 on the Billboard 200. One of Swiftâ€™s most popular songs from the record, â€œThe Fate of Ophelia,â€ also logged four weeks on the Hot 100 last month, making Swift the only artist to debut at No. 1 on both charts simultaneously and hold the spots for a month straight.

schema.headline: Taylor Swift Reveals Two Favorite Songs From Her Catalog on â€˜The Late Show With Stephen Colbertâ€™: Rankings are â€˜Constantly Changingâ€™

title: Film4 Hires Mubiâ€™s Co-Head of Global Acquisitions Cate Kane as Senior Commissioning Executive
description:
Film4 has announced the appointment of Cate Kane as senior commissioning executive.

	Kane will join the creative team in January 2026 and report to
body:
Film4 has announced the appointment of Cate Kane as senior commissioning executive.

	Kane will join the creative team in January 2026 and report to Farhana Bhula, director of Film4, alongside senior commissioning executive David Kimbangi.

	Kane joins Film4 from Mubi where she was most recently co-head of global acquisitions since 2020, acquiring titles including â€œAftersun,â€ â€œThe Substance,â€ â€œMy Fatherâ€™s Shadowâ€ and â€œThe Worst Person in the World.â€ Prior to this, she was head of acquisitions at Curzon Film for nine years. Cate has also worked at BBC Film, Casarotto Ramsay and Content Film.
	

	At Film4, Kane is set to play a key role in shaping Film4â€™s slate, partnering closely with filmmakers to shepherd projects from early development through to production. 


	â€œHaving collaborated with Film4 for many years, Iâ€™m over the moon to now join Farhanaâ€™s brilliant team and help build on their extraordinary slate,â€ said Kane. â€œFilm4 has always been the creative home for filmmakers that have inspired me and I canâ€™t wait to champion both established and emerging voices for audiences everywhere.â€

	Added Bhula: â€œIâ€™m delighted that Cate Kane will be joining Film4 as a senior commissioning executive. Cate is an exceptional creative force whose instincts, track record, and vision perfectly align with the next chapter of Film4. She has proven to be fearless in backing some of the most exciting new voices from the U.K. and is deeply committed to championing work that resonates with global audiences.â€

	Film4 recently celebrated backing four directorial debut films set to receive their world premieres at Sundance in 2026, including Molly Mannersâ€™s â€œExtra Geography,â€ Rafael Manuelâ€™s â€œFilipiÃ±ana,â€ Olive Nwosoâ€™s â€œLadyâ€ and Joanna Natasegaraâ€™s â€œThe Disciple.â€
	

	Film4â€™s current production slate includes Alice Birchâ€™s â€œSweetsickâ€ starring Cate Blanchett, Jonathan Scheyâ€™s â€œEverybody Wants To F*ck Meâ€ starring Taron Egerton, Andrew Haighâ€™s â€œA Long Winterâ€ and Bijan Sheibaniâ€™s â€œThe Arrival.â€

schema.headline: Film4 Hires Mubiâ€™s Co-Head of Global Acquisitions Cate Kane as Senior Commissioning Executive

title: â€˜South Parkâ€™ Season 28 Finale: Trump Celebrates the Death of His Satanic Baby
description: The â€œSouth Parkâ€ Season 28 finale brought Christmas cheer to the small Rocky Mountain town and saw Donald Trump and Satanâ€™s baby meet an untimely de
body:
The â€œSouth Parkâ€ Season 28 finale brought Christmas cheer to the small Rocky Mountain town and saw Donald Trump and Satanâ€™s baby meet an untimely demise.

	At the episodeâ€™s climax, Trump, JD Vance, Peter Thiel and Pete Hegseth prepared for a showdown in the hospital against Stan, the Christmas Critters and Jesus over the fate of Satanâ€™s unborn child. However, just as the battle was about to commence, a doctor rushed in with some bad news.
	

	â€œWe looked at the ultrasound, and it appears that at some point when nobody was watching, the baby hung itself and took its own life,â€ the doctor said. Pulling out his phone, he added, â€œIâ€™m afraid you can see it all in the video. The baby got hold of some bedsheets. There are a couple of minutes missing from the ultrasound, but itâ€™s definitely a suicide.â€


	The anticlimactic punchline is most likely a reference to the death of convicted sex offender and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. In 2019, while awaiting trial for sex trafficking charges, Epstein hung himself in his cell at New Yorkâ€™s Metropolitan Correctional Center. However, the surveillance recording is missing the part when he actually committed the act of suicide, leading some to speculate about the circumstances of his death.

	At the end of the episode, Trump throws a lavish party in celebration of his babyâ€™s death, while Satan, completely dejected, packs up his things and leaves the White House.

	â€œSouth Parkâ€ Seasons 27 and 28 have been some of the most exposive in recent memory, revolving mostly around the Trump administration and the presidentâ€™s tumultuous relationship with Satan. Highlights from Season 27 and 28 include Trump running through the desert naked, Kristi Noemâ€™s ICE raiding a production of â€œDora the Explorer Liveâ€ and Cartman vomiting all over Palantir co-founder Thiel. From start to finish, â€œSouth Parkâ€ received backlash from the White House and from members of the Trump administration, but never from the president himself.

schema.headline: â€˜South Parkâ€™ Season 28 Finale: Trump Celebrates the Death of His Satanic Baby

title: Ramzi Bashourâ€™s Sundance Title â€˜Hot Water,â€™ Starring Lubna Azabal, Acquired by Films Boutique (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Films Boutique has picked up international sales rights to â€œHot Water,â€ which has been selected for Sundanceâ€™s U.S. Dramatic Competition. Cinetic Me
body:
Films Boutique has picked up international sales rights to â€œHot Water,â€ which has been selected for Sundanceâ€™s U.S. Dramatic Competition. Cinetic Media is handling North American sales.

	â€œHot Waterâ€ is Syrian-American filmmaker Ramzi Bashourâ€™s feature debut. Bashour, who wrote the script, was a Sundance Fellow in 2022, 2023 and 2024 with the project.

	The film follows an American kid and his Lebanese mom, who â€“ after heâ€™s kicked out of his Indiana high school â€“ hit the road west.
	

	The cast includes Lubna Azabal, known for two Oscar nominated films, Hany Abu-Assadâ€™s â€œParadise Nowâ€ and Denis Villeneuveâ€™s â€œIncendies,â€ and â€œThe Blue Caftanâ€ by Maryam Touzani.


	Also in the cast is Daniel Zolghadri, seen recently in Mary Bronsteinâ€™s â€œIf I Had Legs Iâ€™d Kick Youâ€ and Alex Russellâ€™s â€œLurker,â€ as well as â€œFunny Pages,â€ directed by Owen Kline.

	Also in the cast is Dale Dickey, who starred in Max Walker-Silvermanâ€™s â€œA Love Songâ€ and Debra Granikâ€™s Oscar-nominated â€œWinterâ€™s Bone,â€ and in series like â€œBreaking Badâ€ and â€œTrue Blood.â€

	Films Boutiqueâ€™s CEO, Jean-Christophe Simon, said: â€œWe are glad to head back to Park City, for one last time, with such a gem as Ramziâ€™s first feature. His take on the traditional North American road story will rejoice American and international audiences alike. Ramzi is a talent, and the film will clearly be one of the beautiful discoveries of the festival for international festivals and buyers.â€

	The producers are Jesse Hope, Walker-Silverman and Josh Peters. The director of photography is Alfonso Herrera Salcedo; the production designer is Juliana Barreto Barreto; the costume designer is Stine Dahlman; and the editor is Mollie Goldstein. Casting is by Ann Goulder; sound design is by Javier Umpierrez; and music is by Bashour and James Elkington.
	

	Bashour grew up in Beirut, Lebanon, but is now based in New York. An alumnus of the NYU graduate film program, his thesis short â€œThe Treesâ€ won the International Special Jury Prize at Clermont-Ferrand Film Festival and the main jury prize at Prague Shorts. Bashour was featured in Filmmaker Magazineâ€™s â€œ25 New Faces in Independent Film.â€

	He was an associate producer on Walker-Silvermanâ€™s feature debut, â€œA Love Song,â€ which premiered in Sundance in 2022.

schema.headline: Ramzi Bashourâ€™s Sundance Title â€˜Hot Water,â€™ Starring Lubna Azabal, Acquired by Films Boutique (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus Felt â€˜Backed Into a Cornerâ€™ to Reveal Her 2017 Cancer Diagnosis After â€˜Veepâ€™ Production Delay: â€˜250 People Werenâ€™t Going to Be Workingâ€™
description: Julia Louis-Dreyfus revealed on Amy Poehlerâ€™s â€œGood Hangâ€ podcast that she felt â€œbacked into a cornerâ€ when she publicly disclosed her breast cancer
body:
Julia Louis-Dreyfus revealed on Amy Poehlerâ€™s â€œGood Hangâ€ podcast that she felt â€œbacked into a cornerâ€ when she publicly disclosed her breast cancer diagnosis in 2017. At the time, HBOâ€™s â€œVeepâ€ was preparing for its seventh and final season, but production was delayed while Louis-Dreyfus underwent chemotherapy.

	On the Dec. 9 episode of the â€œGood Hangâ€ podcast, host Poehler praised Louis-Dreyfus for being open about her diagnosis, saying the disclosure was â€œvery helpful for a lot of people.â€ But Louis-Dreyfus explained that going public wasnâ€™t entirely her choice.
	

	â€œI was kind of backed into a corner on that one because we had to shut our show down,â€ the â€œVeepâ€ star said. â€œItâ€™s funny how that worked out, because normally I would not have done that. Iâ€™m very private.â€


	Louis-Dreyfus played Selina Meyer on â€œVeepâ€ from 2012 to 2019, earning six consecutive Emmys for outstanding lead actress in a comedy series.

	According to Louis-Dreyfus, who also served as an executive producer, production on the final season of the HBO series had to shut down â€œfor a yearâ€ so she could undergo chemotherapy. â€œTwo hundred fifty people werenâ€™t going to be working,â€ she added, â€œso I had to make a public thing about it.â€

	Even though she had reservations, Louis-Dreyfus said sheâ€™s ultimately glad she shared her diagnosis because it allowed her to connect with others who were also battling cancer.

	â€œThe good thing about doing that was that I did have this incredible experience of people reaching out to me asking me for, you know, asking me about my experience going through breast cancer, for advice,â€ she said. â€œAnd I was able to help and there was something unbelievably comforting about being able to do that on the other side of this trauma.â€
	

	Louis-Dreyfus was diagnosed with breast cancer in September 2017. She announced the news on Twitter (now X), writing, â€œ1 in 8 women get breast cancer. Today, Iâ€™m the one.â€

	â€œThe good news is that I have the most glorious group of supportive and caring family and friends,â€ she added. â€œThe bad news is that not all women are so lucky, so letâ€™s fight all cancers and make universal health care a reality.â€

	Watch Louis-Dreyfusâ€™ full interview on the â€œGood Hangâ€ podcast below.

schema.headline: Julia Louis-Dreyfus Felt â€˜Backed Into a Cornerâ€™ to Reveal Her 2017 Cancer Diagnosis After â€˜Veepâ€™ Production Delay: â€˜250 People Werenâ€™t Going to Be Workingâ€™

title: Golden Globes Honors Hend Sabry, Alia Bhatt at Red Sea Film Festival
description: The Golden Globes honored Tunisian actress Hend Sabry and Indian actress Alia Bhatt at a glitzy gala dinner late Wednesday evening during the fifth
body:
The Golden Globes honored Tunisian actress Hend Sabry and Indian actress Alia Bhatt at a glitzy gala dinner late Wednesday evening during the fifth edition of Saudi Arabiaâ€™s Red Sea Film Festival. Sabry was named the recipient of the Omar Sharif Award and Bhatt received the Golden Globes Horizon Award.

	Among the guests at the event were directors Sean Baker and Darren Aronofsky, actresses Sigourney Weaver, Naomie Harris, Shailene Woodley and Olga Kurylenko, actor-director Idris Elba, and actors Ã‰dgar RamÃ­rez, Salman Khan, Henry Golding and Riz Ahmed.
	

	Sabryâ€™s performances in films such as â€œThe Yacoubian Building,â€ â€œScheherazade,â€ â€œTell Me a Storyâ€ and â€œAsmaaâ€ won her widespread recognition for her nuanced portrayals of complex, socially resonant characters.


	Bhatt has earned critical acclaim and box-office success for standout performances in films such as â€œHighway,â€ â€œRaazi,â€ â€œUdta Punjab,â€ â€œDear Zindagiâ€ and â€œGangubai Kathiawadi.â€ 

	Helen Hoehne, president of the Golden Globes, described Sarby as â€œa truly iconic performer and humanitarian whose body of work reflects the depth, power, and global impact of Arab cinema.â€ The award for Bhatt, she said, celebrated â€œher exceptional contributions to international cinema.â€

	Sabry said, â€œMy career has been devoted to uplifting women with complex stories and I am thrilled to be sharing this Golden Globes stage with Alia Bhatt, one of the next generationâ€™s brightest and most talented stars.â€

	Bhatt said, â€œThe Golden Globes are an iconic part of the global awards universe and I am delighted to be part of it and look forward to continuing my career in telling more stories of powerful and deserving women.â€
	

	Golden Globes is owned by Dick Clark Prods., which is, in turn, owned by Variety parent company PMC, in a joint venture with Eldridge.

schema.headline: Golden Globes Honors Hend Sabry, Alia Bhatt at Red Sea Film Festival

title: EFM FrontiÃ¨res Focus Unveils Lineup, Featuring Bosnian PTSD Folk Horror, Irish Sexual Fantasy and the Whole Truth, Perhaps, About Legendary Skyjacker â€˜D.B. Cooperâ€™Â  (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Kan MuftiÄ‡â€™s â€œWith Blessings on Your Way,â€ Rioghnach Ni Ghrioghairâ€™s â€œTouch Meâ€ and â€œOriental Snatch,â€ from â€œHundreds of Beaversâ€™â€ co-creator Ryland
body:
Kan MuftiÄ‡â€™s â€œWith Blessings on Your Way,â€ Rioghnach Ni Ghrioghairâ€™s â€œTouch Meâ€ and â€œOriental Snatch,â€ from â€œHundreds of Beaversâ€™â€ co-creator Ryland Brickson Cole Tews have been selected for the Berlin Film Festivalâ€™s inaugural, EFM FrontiÃ©res Focus, a five-movie genre showcase which lifts off as horror and fantasy pics drive an ever larger part of the international sales business.Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 
	

	Unveiled Thursday, the section also features Vanessa Magicâ€™s â€œNadine Pick up the Phoneâ€ and â€œSplit Rock,â€ from Ryan Glover, also from Canada.Â 


	The five projects were selected from â€œclose toâ€ 100 submissions, a heartwarming response, said FrontiÃ¨res Executive Director Annick Mahnert.Â 


	Announced in August, the EFM FrontiÃ¨res Focus sets out to highlight â€œthe depth, range and artistry of genre cinema,â€ the Berlin Festival and FrontiÃ¨res said at the launch.

	Certainly, the Focus underscores the range of current genre output. Folk horror, but unspooling in Bosnia, â€œWith Blessings on Your Way,â€ for instance, delivers what looks like a potentially powerful, movingÂ  and grounded metaphor for haunting post-War collective trauma in Bosnia.Â 

	â€œTouch Meâ€ marks the awaited feature debut of Irelandâ€™s Rioghnach Ni Ghrioghair, who sparked large praise for the direction of her 20-minute â€œDonâ€™t Go Where I Canâ€™t Find You,â€ a grief-driven sensorial ghost story whichÂ played SXSW in 2022.

	An U.S.-Brazil production, the fun-outrageous â€œOriental Snatchâ€ marks the latest from the irrepressible Ryland Brickson Cole Tews, co-creator and star of 2023â€™s â€œHundreds of Beavers.â€ It will give â€œall the answersâ€ to the 1971 real-life case of â€œD.B. Cooperâ€, theÂ only documented unsolved case of plane hijacking. â€œOriental Snatchâ€ may offer more, however. A concept art poster features an armor-plated alligator sporting a Nazi armband.
	



	

					â€˜Oriental Snatchâ€™ Courtesy of FrontiÃ¨res
	



	â€œEach title has a very different identity and offer different stories,â€ said Mahnert, calling â€œNadine Pick Up the Phoneâ€ as a â€œdreamy, lighter comedy drama about trauma and a woman who meets someone in shared dreams who can help her, which I hadnâ€™t seen before,â€ and â€œSplit Rockâ€ as â€œperhaps more straightforward â€“ science fiction horror.â€

	â€œWith the tools of today, someone can shoot a film with their iPhone and have AI and are able to produce special effects. Thereâ€™s no limitation anymore to imagination,â€ Mahnert added.Â 

	â€œGenre filmmaking is enjoying a remarkable surge in creativity and visibility, attracting leading creative voices, top talent and bigger budgets and EFM FrontiÃ¨res Focus will place it firmly in the spotlight,â€ Tanja Meissner, director of Berlinale Pro, said in August, announcing the new market focus.

	Certainly, the directors of all five titles have credentials. â€œWith Blessings On Your Wayâ€ marks the live action feature debut of Muftic, a renowned concept artistÂ  (â€œBioshock 2â€) and animation director (â€œKiss Me Firstâ€). A silent, black-and-white movie, the LOL â€œHundreds of Beaversâ€ grossed $1.4 million worldwide.Â 

	â€œSplit Rockâ€ is Gloverâ€™s second feature after the Shudder-acquired â€œThe Strings.â€ â€œNadine Pick up the Phoneâ€ was selected for the Telefilm Canadaâ€™s Talent To Watch Program and won the Canadian Film Festivalâ€™s You-CAN-Pitch Competition. After â€œDonâ€™t Go Where I Canâ€™t Find You,â€ Rioghnach Ni Ghrioghair is reckoned one of the young directors to track from Ireland.Â 

	The directors can be touchingly original. â€œIn a world saturated with technology, tactile, handmade approaches to filmmaking have become a guiding force for me, inviting the audience into the strange, emotional, and often absurd terrain of our existence,â€ says Magic, writer-director of â€œNadine Pick Up the Phone.â€



	

					â€˜Nadine Pick Up the Phoneâ€™ Courtesy of FrontiÃ¨res
	



	If there is one trend, many of the titles are genre blenders, â€œSplit Rock,â€ an eco/supernatural/body horror thriller, for example.Â 

	â€œSplit Rockâ€ is in post-production. The other four titles are advancing with financing. In this sense, the EFM FrontiÃ¨res Focus is designed to complement FrontiÃ¨res Platform at Cannesâ€™ MarchÃ© du Film and Fantasiaâ€™s FrontiÃ¨res Market in Montreal in July, said Mahnert.Â 
	

	â€œCannes focuses on proof of concept or post, and Montreal on titles in really early development or very, very early production. We get so many films in post-production that thereâ€™s enough for two events,â€ she added.Â 

	A closer look at the five EFM FrontiÃ¨res Focus titles: Â  Â 

	â€œNadine Pick up the Phone,â€ (Vanessa Magic, Canada)

	Nadine, grief-stricken, listless, 40, answers a strange help-wanted ad to share her lucid dreams. She meets a mysterious young man whose connection to her dream world unlocks long-buried family secrets.Â â€œA film about the power of dreams and the necessity of human connection when processing grief,â€ blurring the boundary between fantasy and reality, â€œ says writer-director Magic. A potentially touching entry, produced by Bonnie Doâ€™s Toronto-based House Panther Films. Â 

	â€œOriental Snatch,â€ (Chris Tex, Ryland Brickson Cole Tews)

	â€œThe outrageous true story of the enigmatic air pirate, â€œD.B. Cooperâ€ and his infamous 1971 plane heist. Where did he come from? Where did he go? What really happened on that fateful day? All questions will be answered and several more raised in this sexy, action, adventure, mystery, horror, romance! The only surefire way to learn the real story of D.B. Cooper is by watching â€˜Oriental Snatch,â€™ where truth is spookier than fiction. Also D.B. Cooper is directing the film,â€ Brickson Cole Tews teased to Variety. Chris Tex (â€œWind Princessâ€) directs.

	â€œSplit Rock,â€ (Ryan Glover, Canada)

	In the Saskatchewan badlands, unearthing an unusual boulder of highly magnetic stone, geologist Laurenâ€™s body suffers terrifying transformations as her mind is eroded by an ancient force of destruction. Melding ecological and possession sub-genres, shot on location with widescreen, anamorphic lenses â€œwith the tactile 16mm cinematography and practical special effects that were crafted for the film, something unique and trulyÂ disturbing,â€ said Glover. Produced by Torontoâ€™s Low-End, Observer Effect and U.S., Mexico and Canada-based Prowler Pictures.Â  Â 



	

					â€˜Split Rock,â€™ Courtesy of FrontiÃ¨res
	



	â€œTouch Me,â€ (Rioghnach Ni Ghrioghair, Ireland)

	Marianne, an exquisite florist, suffers a fear of skin-to-skin contact, until a serial killerâ€™s murders ignites her darkest desires. â€œI want to examine womenâ€™s own relationships with their bodies and with the violent male-dominated world we live in,â€ says Ni Ghrioghair, whose â€œDonâ€™t Go Where I Canâ€™t Find Youâ€ at SXSW in 2022. Produced by Claire Mc Cabe (â€œBlue Road â€“ The Edna Oâ€™Brien Storyâ€) at Pipedream Productions and Fantastic Films (â€œYou Are Not My Motherâ€).Â 
	

	â€œWith Blessings on Your Way,â€(Kan MuftiÄ‡, U.K., Bosnia Herzegovina)

	Deep in the Bosnian mountains, a reclusive war survivor named Tarik is believed to have awakened malignant supernatural forces and is cast out into the forest. Embraced by hornets, he returns transformed, an otherworldly presence that haunts his wife and blurs the line between reality and buried trauma. Londonâ€™s Snafu Pictures (â€œBad Dinosaursâ€) lead produces. The story is â€œborn from personal experience in Bosnia Herzegovina. Many of us in the cast and crew quietly live with PTSD while pretending everything is fine,â€ Kan MuftiÄ‡ told Variety. Â 



	

					â€˜With Blessings on Your Wayâ€™ Courtesy of FrontiÃ©res

schema.headline: EFM FrontiÃ¨res Focus Unveils Lineup, Featuring Bosnian PTSD Folk Horror, Irish Sexual Fantasy and the Whole Truth, Perhaps, About Legendary Skyjacker â€˜D.B. Cooperâ€™Â  (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Jen Shah Gets Big Salt Lake City Welcome After Prison Release
description:
'RHOSLC' Alum Jen Shah
                          Breaks Down During Salt Lake City Return
body:
'RHOSLC' Alum Jen Shah
                          Breaks Down During Salt Lake City Return
                      
                  
                        Published December 10, 2025 7:31 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    BACKGRID
          
    
          Jen Shah finally reunited with her family and friends after spending 33 months behind bars in Texas ... marking the first time she's been seen since her prison release.
      
    
          "The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City" alum was captured arriving at Salt Lake City International Airport on Wednesday night after flying home on a commercial flight from Texas, where she'd been incarcerated since 2022.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Several friends and family members were waiting to welcome her at the airport, greeting her with balloons, flowers, and emotional embraces. Jen was accompanied on the flight by her husband, Sharrieff Shah.
      

          Jen stayed quiet when a photographer asked whether she'd had any interactions with fellow high-profile inmates convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell or disgraced former tech CEO Elizabeth Holmes during her time at FPC Bryan.
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          As we reported ... Jen is now under community confinement ... meaning she'll spend her time either in home confinement or at a halfway house as she continues serving her sentence.
      
    
          Jen's legal troubles stem from her 2022 guilty plea to conspiracy to commit wire fraud in a telemarketing scheme that targeted elderly victims. She received 6.5 years in federal prison plus five years of supervised release.

schema.headline: Jen Shah Gets Big Salt Lake City Welcome After Prison Release

title: Former NBA Player Isaiah Rider Arrested After Allegedly Violating Protective Order
description:
Ex-NBA'er Isaiah Rider
                          Arrested For Violating Protective Order
body:
Ex-NBA'er Isaiah Rider
                          Arrested For Violating Protective Order
                      
                  
                        Published December 11, 2025 12:30 AM PST
                                                                            
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          NBA champion Isaiah Rider was arrested earlier this month after he allegedly violated a court order ... TMZ Sports has learned.
      
    
          Law enforcement sources tell us that the 54-year-old was arrested on December 4 and charged with one count of interfering with judicial proceedings.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          According to court documents we obtained ... "J.R.'s" wife, Vanessa, filed for a protective order back in July 2025. In the application, she alleged Rider was aggressive on multiple occasions, including a time when she claims Isaiah said, "You're gonna get your ass slapped."
      

          "Shut the f*** up before I kick this door down and whoop you."
      
    
          Vanessa claimed the comments were directed at both her and her 15-year-old son.
      
    
          At the time, Isaiah responded to the allegations, writing ... "I deny the allegations. She did this because I filed for divorce."
      
    
          According to court records, the nine-year NBA veteran filed for divorce from Vanessa in November 2024.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Vanessa was still able to obtain the protective order in July, which required Isaiah to have no contact with his wife or their 15-year-old son. He was also ordered to stay away from their residence and his son's school.
      
    
          A hearing is scheduled for December 17, during which time the court will decide whether the order should be continued.
      
    
          Rider, the 1994 Slam Dunk champion, played for five different teams over the course of his NBA career ... hopping with Minnesota, Portland, Atlanta, the L.A. Lakers, and Denver. Throughout his career, he was known as one of the best athletes in the league.
      
    
          J.R. won the 2001 NBA championship with the Lakers ... but was left off the playoff roster.

schema.headline: Former NBA Player Isaiah Rider Arrested After Allegedly Violating Protective Order
